rsc_base_frr_rsc_01.name: Top-Level Administrative Accounts Guidance
rsc_base_frr_rsc_01.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_01.instructions: Providers MUST create and maintain guidance that includes instructions on how to securely access, configure, operate, and decommission _top-level administrative accounts_ that control enterprise access to the entire _cloud service offering_.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_02.name: Top-Level Administrative Accounts Security Settings Guidance
rsc_base_frr_rsc_02.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_02.instructions: Providers MUST create and maintain guidance that explains security-related settings that can be operated only by _top-level administrative accounts_ and their security implications.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_03.name: Privileged Accounts Security Settings Guidance
rsc_base_frr_rsc_03.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_03.instructions: Providers SHOULD create and maintain guidance that explains security-related settings that can be operated only by _privileged accounts_ and their security implications.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_04.name: Secure Defaults on Provisioning
rsc_base_frr_rsc_04.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_04.instructions: Providers SHOULD set all settings to their recommended secure defaults for _top-level administrative accounts_ and _privileged accounts_ when initially provisioned.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_05.name: Comparison Capability
rsc_base_frr_rsc_05.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_05.instructions: Providers SHOULD offer the capability to compare all current settings for _top-level administrative accounts_ and _privileged accounts_ to the recommended secure defaults.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_06.name: Export Capability
rsc_base_frr_rsc_06.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_06.instructions: Providers SHOULD offer the capability to export all security settings in a _machine-readable_ format.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_07.name: API Capability
rsc_base_frr_rsc_07.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_07.instructions: Providers SHOULD offer the capability to view and adjust security settings via an API or similar capability.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_08.name: Machine-Readable Guidance
rsc_base_frr_rsc_08.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_08.instructions: Providers SHOULD provide recommended secure configuration guidance in a _machine-readable_ format that can be used by customers or third-party tools to compare against current settings.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_09.name: Publish Guidance
rsc_base_frr_rsc_09.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_09.instructions: Providers SHOULD make recommended secure configuration guidance available publicly.

rsc_base_frr_rsc_10.name: Versioning and Release History
rsc_base_frr_rsc_10.description: FedRAMP RSC > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
rsc_base_frr_rsc_10.instructions: Providers SHOULD provide versioning and a release history for recommended secure default settings for _top-level administrative accounts_ and _privileged accounts_ as they are adjusted over time.
